message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a new way of using fully convolutional networks for text classification, which is a common task in natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The use of convolutional networks also suggests a potential application in computer vision (cs.CV) for tasks such as image classification. The modifications on the idea of attention and the discussion of suboptimal results suggest a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the proposed fix for improving results involves incorporating external knowledge, which is a common approach in information retrieval (cs.IR).
